com.amazon.device.messaging.development

Class ADMManifest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazon.device.messaging.development.ADMManifest

  • public final class ADMManifest
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains utility methods and constants to assist with authoring a manifest that supports ADM.
    Since:
    {public final class com.amazon.device.messaging.development.ADMManifest {}

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_MESSAGE_HANDLER_CLASS_NAME
      The name of your message handler class.
      static java.lang.String PERMISSION_RECEIVE_MESSAGES
      An Android permission required to receive ADM messages.
      static java.lang.String PERMISSION_SEND_MESSAGES
      An Android permission required to send ADM messages.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void checkManifestAuthoredProperly(android.content.Context context)
      Validates that your manifest has properly defined all of the permissions, receivers, and services needed to interact with ADM.
      static java.lang.String getReceiverPermission(android.content.Context context)
      Provides the permission that should be declared in your manifest to prevent other apps from reading your messages.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_MESSAGE_HANDLER_CLASS_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_MESSAGE_HANDLER_CLASS_NAME
        The name of your message handler class. ADM looks for a class of this name in the manifest, if you do not specify a different name in ADMMessageReceiver.ADMMessageReceiver(Class).
        Since:
        {public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_MESSAGE_HANDLER_CLASS_NAME;}
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_SEND_MESSAGES

        public static final java.lang.String PERMISSION_SEND_MESSAGES
        An Android permission required to send ADM messages. You can require this to ensure that broadcasts sent to your app are coming from ADM.
        Since:
        {public static final java.lang.String PERMISSION_SEND_MESSAGES;}
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_RECEIVE_MESSAGES

        public static final java.lang.String PERMISSION_RECEIVE_MESSAGES
        An Android permission required to receive ADM messages. Your app must have a <uses-permission> tag in its manifest for this permission.
        Since:
        {public static final java.lang.String PERMISSION_RECEIVE_MESSAGES;}
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • checkManifestAuthoredProperly

        public static void checkManifestAuthoredProperly(android.content.Context context)
        Validates that your manifest has properly defined all of the permissions, receivers, and services needed to interact with ADM. Use this during development.
        Parameters:
        context - The application context.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if ADM is not supported on the device or the manifest is incorrectly authored.
        Since:
        {public static void checkManifestAuthoredProperly(android.content.Context);}

      • getReceiverPermission

        public static java.lang.String getReceiverPermission(android.content.Context context)
        Provides the permission that should be declared in your manifest to prevent other apps from reading your messages.
        Parameters:
        context - The application context.
        Returns:
        The permission to declare in your app manifest.
        Since:
        {public static java.lang.String getReceiverPermission(android.content.Context);}
